Chapter 2 Data sources 2.1 Crawling Datasets All the dataset are crawled by the python. See the python scripts in folder DataMinning for the details of crawling datasets. The price datasets: https://binance-docs.github.io/apidocs/spot/en/#change-log The fundmental datasets: https://docs.glassnode.com/ The fear index: https://alternative.me/crypto/fear-and-greed-index/ We would used the Raw Datasets to create the target variables. 2.2 Calcuate the basis: Our trading strategy is based on the future swap and perpetual swap. The expiration date of those contracts are 2020-06-26, 2020-09-25, 2020-12-25, 2021-03-26, 2021-06-25, 2021-09-24, 2021-12-31, 2022-03-25 Raw Data Set Description: Time: the hour-level granularity time represent the time period between last hour to current hour Open: the first trade price in current time period High: the highest trade price in current time period Low: the lowest trade price in current time period Close: the last trade price in current time period Other features: Ignore 2.2.3 Calculate the % basis Equation Basis = (future - perpetual) / perpetual * 100 Data Description Date: the date Perpetual: the price of perpetual contract for a BTC Future: the price of future contract for a BTC Basis: the % ratio basis Example: the Basis DataFrame of the contract expired at 2020-06-26 ## date perpetual future basis ## 1 2020-03-02 8750.138 9084.265 3.818543 ## 2 2020-03-03 8782.385 9091.958 3.524938 ## 3 2020-03-04 8756.864 9042.914 3.266580 ## 4 2020-03-05 9012.137 9320.990 3.427076 ## 5 2020-03-06 9079.136 9427.576 3.837813 ## 6 2020-03-07 9034.801 9372.068 3.732973 2.2.4 Calculate Annual Basis: Converting the quarter basis to the annual basis Annual Basis: because the basis highly depends on the expiration days.
